Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the statement that COVID-19 vaccinations have already killed several youngsters.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that COVID-19 vaccinations will be required before children can return to school, without considering the local decision-making processes and factors involved.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that as of mid-2020, no effective COVID-19 vaccine existed, making the statement about mandatory vaccinations for school return inaccurate.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential harm of COVID-19 vaccinations by stating that "many kids will die from the COVID-19 vaccine" when no effective vaccine exists yet.
Understate: No understatement bias is evident in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by making false or speculative statements without reliable evidence or factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: No alternative explanation bias is evident in this claim.
